related.meaning: House of Councillors (upper house of the National Diet of Japan)
House of Representatives (lower house of the National Diet of Japan)

lessons.japanese: 異議がなかったので、彼らはその計画を進めた。
lessons.english: They went ahead with the plan since there were no objections.

lessons.japanese: 彼を議長に据えることに誰も異議を唱えなかった。
lessons.english: Nobody argued against choosing him as chairman.

lessons.japanese: だからといって異議があるわけではない。
lessons.english: Not that I have any objection.

lessons.japanese: この計画に異議はありますか。
lessons.english: Do you have any objection to this plan?

lessons.japanese: 必要であれば、特別料金を払うことに対して、異議は申しません。
lessons.english: I have no objection to paying a special fee if it is necessary.

lessons.japanese: 彼女の提案に異議を唱えるとは君も大胆だ。
lessons.english: It is bold of you to question her proposal.

lessons.japanese: 彼は大多数の意見に異議を唱えた。
lessons.english: He dissented from the opinion of the majority.

lessons.japanese: 彼は異議を唱える誰に対しても腹を立てた。
lessons.english: He got angry with whoever challenged him.

lessons.japanese: 彼の方には異議がなかった。
lessons.english: There was no objection on his part.

lessons.japanese: 彼の家族の方は異議ありません。
lessons.english: It's all right on the part of his family.

lessons.japanese: 彼のほうには異議はなかった。
lessons.english: There was no objection on his part.

lessons.japanese: 出席者の側には異議はなかった。
lessons.english: There was no objection on the part of those present.

lessons.japanese: 従業員たちは超過勤務をするのに異議を唱えた。
lessons.english: The employees demurred at working overtime.

lessons.japanese: 私はあなたの意見に異議はない。
lessons.english: I have no objection to your opinion.
